column6: Benefits provided to full-time employees that are not provided to temporary or part-time employees
column7: If a company in the TSR comparator group is suspended or delisted from the ASX during the performance period, it may be removed from the comparator group. There may, therefore, be fewer than 100 companies in the broad-based comparator group and fewer than 14 companies in the customised comparator group for that period. No LTI related to the TSR performance measure will vest unless the Company achieves a relative 50th percentile (median) or above TSR. Any performance rights not granted at the end of the performance period are lapsed. Further details on TSR, the vesting schedule, and other terms and conditions can be found on page 79 of the Remuneration Report. The fair value of the shares vested measures the fair value of services received in return for LTI granted. The estimate of the fair value of the shares is calculated based on a Monte Carlo simulation pricing model. It reflects that the vesting of the shares depends on meeting performance criteria based on TSR. The vesting of the shares is also subject to non-market conditions; however, these are not considered in the grant date fair value measurement of the services received.

column6: Parental leave
column7: Suncorp welcomed a boost to parental leave entitlements this year. Primary carers in Australia are now offered an additional four weeks of leave (to a total of 20 weeks) and secondary carers an extra one week of leave (to a total of four weeks). Employees can now access paid parental leave entitlements upon commencement with Suncorp.

column6: Minimum notice periods regarding operational changes
Occupation health and safety management system
column8: Safety and Wellbeing in the Workplace
column13: Suncorp will promote an environment in which our People are respectful and supportive of each other, feel empowered to raise issues or concerns relating to safety and well-being risks and take timely action to address Issues and prevent Workplace Injury or Illness. Suncorp recognises that our flexibility is critical to an engaged, healthy and productive workforce. Suncorp is committed to actively supporting flexibility, including a blend of office and home-based work, where role type and business needs permit.
column20: Workplace Injury or Illness, Flexibility, Healthy and Productive Workforce

column6: Occupation health and safety management system
column13: Suncorp maintains a systematic approach to managing safety and well-being Issues and risks that is responsive and Consultative in identifying, reviewing and controlling risk. An integrated framework provides instruction, supervision, and timely safety and wellbeing information so people can do their jobs safely. Our People are supported and encouraged to participate in sustainable return-to-work outcomes through appropriate Workplace Rehabilitation that considers individual and workplace factors. Proper governance, oversight, and compliance controls are in place to ensure the workplace is well maintained and work is safely performed. Suncorp is further supported by appropriately qualified resourcing to execute our commitment to safety and wellbeing.
column20: Consultative, Controlling Risk, Appropriate Workplace Rehabilitation

column6: Hazard identification, risk assessment, and incident investigation
column7: All Policy breaches must be recorded in IRIIS by the Incident Management Standard, with the Policy Owner notified. Non-compliance with this Policy may result in disciplinary action (including termination of employment). To the extent that this Policy imposes an obligation on Suncorp, it does not form a contractual term, condition or representation.
